Cantera 1.5 for Windows has been released.  This is a major release 
with many new capabilities; if you are using Cantera on a Windows PC, I 
encourage you to upgrade to 1.5.

The release includes:
- demos in MATLAB, Python, Fortran 77, and C++ (all have been tested 
and are now working)
- compiled Cantera libraries (both debug and release versions) for 
linking to Fortran or C++ applications
- all Cantera C++ header files
- a converter program to convert Chemkin reaction mechanism files to 
the new Cantera format
- PowerPoint presentations covering installation, building Fortran 
applications, and the Python and MATLAB demos

Among the examples are premixed burner-stabilized flames, detached 
stagnation-point flames, non-premixed counterflow flames, catalytic 
combustion in stagnation flow, a CVD problem with elementary surface 
chemistry, zero-D reactors with surface chemistry, ...

Hope you enjoy it.

Dave G.
